p: Embelin ( Fig. 1J) interacted with HBV Pol by forming three hydrogen bonds with Lys32 and His160. It also formed one alkyl hydrophobic interaction with Pro5 and three Pi-alkyl hydrophobic interactions with Trp3, Arg41 and Ala86 ( Fig. 7J). Other residues that surrounded embelin were Glu1, Asp2, Gly4, Gln39, Ser40, Leu42, Ser85 and Ala87. The Gibb's free energy of embelin-Pol interaction was predicted to be −6.1 kcal/mol which corresponded to a binding constant of 2.4 × 10 4/mol ( Table 2).
